Description: Rectangular talisman with trapezoidal handle; cast bronze or brass. One side with Jinn mounted on a snake-tailed lion-headed creature, attended by bearded figures bearing censers, with cloven feet, short tunics and pointed hats. Below, three figures similarly attired in lobed arcade. Border of pseudo-hieroglyphs. Other side with panel of pseudo-Kufic/Syriac inscription and two rows of seven-horned figures, the upper row naked and linking wings, the lower wearing short tunics and in a lobed arcade. Parody of Eumorphopoulos canteen?
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2011-2012, 6 Oct-19 Feb, London, The British Museum, 'Grayson Perry: The Tomb of the Unknown Craftsman'
